content: round 4- 16 knit 13 rounds add another needle redistribute the sts so that needle 1 & 3 now have 10 sts each and needle 2 & 4 have 6 sts each round 17 ssk k6 k2tog k6 repeat 28 sts round 18-19 knit round 20 ssk k4 k2tog k6 repeat 24 sts round 21-22 knit round 23 ssk k2 k2tog k6 repeat 20 sts round 24-25 knit round 26 ssk k2tog k6 repeat 16 sts now we will place the 4 sts left on needle 1 & 3 onto needle 2 & 4 to set up the 3-needle bind-off knit the 1 stitch of your new round and put it on needle 4 then take the last remaining st on needle 1 and place it at the front of needle 2 now you can take away needle 1 now place the 2 remaining sts on needle 3 onto the ends of needle 2 & 4 you should now have 2 needles with 8 sts each do a 3-needle bind-off cut yarn and secure hide end in house roof the roof is knit flat in 2 pieces and then joined together with a 3-needle bind-off using your roof color cast on 8 sts leaving a long tail for sewing to the house in finishing row 1-20 knit leave your sts live do not cast off break yarn leaving a long tail for finishing about 8 /20cm cast on another 8 sts and knit 20 row again but this time instead of breaking yarn at the end do a 3- needle bind-off before you start remember to make sure both ends are on the right break yarn about 8 /20cm and secure also secure opposite cast off end don t weave in ends finishing attaching roof put the roof into position next thread your cast off end onto a tapestry needle and insert it downward into the home s top point see x on figure a do the same with the other cast off end but enter in the backs top point now flip your house inside out and knot the 2 cast off ends together figure b the middle of your roof is now secure see figure c to attach the 2 sides use whip stitch and your cast on ends once secure hide ends in house embroidery notes i used sock yarn for my embroidery so i could be more detailed i used a different piece of yarn for each window or door and then knot the 2 ends together underneath for measurements see bottom of pg 2 stuffing make sure all your ends are pushed up into your house and then stuff the bottom stays open for pattern support
